dialogue: Protagonist, it's you... I've been waiting for you to come home.
Who are you?
I'm Darling, dear. Did you forget yourself again?
... I guess so...?
You'll remember eventually. You always do, by the time you get to Wonderland. Everyone forgets who they were when they stay outside of Wonderland for too long.
Wonderland... so I need to go there and I'll be fixed.
It will restore you. But you can't go home now, it's too dangerous. Just wait out here with me. There's something strange going on in Wonderland.
What's going on?
It's growing. Wonderland is trying to spread to the real world.
Well, why should that be my problem? I'm trying to get to Wonderland anyway.
Wonderland is destabilizing. If we lose it, what happens to us? I don't know what we're going to do.
... I don't know either... Well, what's causing all this?
I don't know what or how this is happening, but the Dollhouse residents should know. They guard the gate between Wonderland and the real world.
Lampy in particular. You'll know who they are because they look like their namesake. Cheerful sort.
Where is the Dollhouse?
Just keep on going forward, dear. Be safe, will you?
You're not going to stop me?
I can't stop you from what you want to do. I'm just a rabbit toy, after all. I've spent so long outside of Wonderland that I cannot move anymore.
Do you ever want to go home?
My human needs me. If this is the cost of loving, then I'll bear it.
I see...
Don't worry about me. You'll see me again. Go forward, dear. Don't linger.
